detailedRequirements:
Project Overview

 

The goal of this challenge is to demonstrate how NodeJS API can talk with Sharepoint 2010 web services.

Competition Task Overview

The scenario is as follow :

  • Sharepoint application and NodeJS API are deployed and running. Each application are deployed in separate domains. (they don't use the same domain)
  • Sharepoint is hosting html page, anonymus is not allowed to access the page.
  • The html page has some functionality, some of it will a code via Javascript frontend to pull data from NodeJS API (using jsonp).
  • NodeJS needs to authorize the user who is making the call by calling Sharepoint 2010 SOAP services. Verify the user exists and allowed to peform specific actions in the api.
  • Sharepoint 2010 web service is using NTLM authentication.

You need to demonstrate the following :

  • Simple ExpressJS Application with one GET http endpoint: the backend expect to receive user ID and use it to verify information about the user by calling Sharepoint web service 2010 SOAP.
  • Sharepoint 2010 config should use NTLM.
  • ExpressJS should have a middleware to call the Sharepoint 2010 service to verify the user (NTLM authentication is needed to perform the operation) before processing the requests.
  • Provided a node module we created via other challenge, the module is used in nodejs to create a NTLM authentication and verify user. The client should be initizlied once, if the connection went down it should be reinitiated.
  • Provide detailed document for how to setup page in sharpeoint, enable NTLM in web services, setup nodejs, and how to verify the whole process.

Technology Overview

The working environment requirement details for this application are outlined in the Application Requirements Specification. An overview of the environment requirements are listed below:

  • Sharepoint 2010
  • NodeJS
  • NTLM
  • Express 3.0

Sharepoint VM

We will provide Sharepoint VM will be provided, as we have limited # of VMs, Only members who has consistent previous record winning Assembly or F2F challenges (preferrably related to Sharepoint) will get a VMs.
